title: Checking Perpendicular Vectors Quiz
description: Test your ability to determine if vectors are perpendicular.

questions.question: What is the condition for two vectors to be perpendicular?
questions.explanation: Two vectors are perpendicular if their dot product is zero.

questions.question: Are vectors a=(2,3,1) and b=(1,-2,4) perpendicular?
questions.explanation: a · b = 2*1 + 3*(-2) + 1*4 = 2 - 6 + 4 = 0, so they are perpendicular.

questions.question: Which of these vectors is perpendicular to (1,2,3)?
The zero vector is perpendicular to:
questions.explanation: The dot product of the zero vector with any vector is always zero, so it is perpendicular to all vectors.

questions.question: Can two parallel non-zero vectors be perpendicular?
questions.explanation: Parallel non-zero vectors have a dot product equal to |a||b|, which is only zero if one vector is zero. So they are never perpendicular.
